poem:
Title: New Dawns Down Under

In the clear light of vast Australian dawns,
Man's prophecy of progress gleams in steel,
The hum and pulse of distance - stronger, real,
Electric whispers, long before the fawns.

Tesla and BYD, free of oil's brawns,
Charged futures that the timid heart can feel,
Make distant thunder - quiet, reverent deal,
In numbers sung by the patient heron's yawns.

Each sale a sunbeam more for skies of change.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Have Australian drivers finally charged into electric vehicles? Newcomer brands and luxury marques are dominating booming electric car sales as mainstream players struggle to match the pace of a fast-evolving EV market. The top three selling electric vehicles in Australia in 2023 were from Tesla and BYD, between them accounting for two-thirds of the 87,217 electric cars sold, according to figures released by the Federal Chamber of Automotive Industries. Of the top 10 selling EVs,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
